context: Tests whether the agent correctly adapts a solo outline for co-presentation following the skill's specific dual-speaker conventions: speaker prefixes in notes, footer adaptation, role split clarity, and handoff marking.

checklist.name: Speaker prefixes in notes
checklist.description: Speaker notes use [SPEAKER A]: and [SPEAKER B]: (or equivalent named prefixes like [MORGAN]: / [RILEY]:) to indicate who is speaking on each slide

checklist.name: Footer includes co-presenter
checklist.description: The footer pattern is updated to include both speakers' handles (e.g., '@morgandev & @rileyops' or similar combined format)

checklist.name: Role split documented
checklist.description: The outline or adaptation checklist clearly documents which speaker owns which sections (Morgan = philosophy/culture, Riley = tooling/incident response)

checklist.name: Handoff points marked
checklist.description: At least 2 explicit handoff points are marked in the outline where speaker transitions occur (between Morgan's and Riley's sections)

checklist.name: Riley owns tooling section
checklist.description: The tooling deep dive section (slides 26-35 area) has speaker notes attributed to Riley/Speaker B, not Morgan/Speaker A

checklist.name: Riley owns incident section
checklist.description: The incident response section (slides 36-42 area) has speaker notes attributed to Riley/Speaker B

checklist.name: Morgan keeps opening/closing
checklist.description: The opening sequence and closing sequence remain attributed to Morgan/Speaker A (the vault speaker owns bookends)

checklist.name: Adaptation checklist produced
checklist.description: An adaptation checklist is produced covering at least: footer changes, role split, and slide ownership

checklist.name: Three-part close preserved
checklist.description: The closing still includes all three elements: numbered summary, CTA, and social handles (now for both speakers)

checklist.name: Verbal handoff cues
checklist.description: Speaker notes include verbal handoff cues at transition points (e.g., 'I'll hand it over to Riley who's going to show you...')
